{{Quote|Say it! You raped [[Elia Martell|her]]! You murdered her! You killed [[Rhaenys Targaryen (daughter of Rhaegar)|her]] [[Aegon Targaryen (Son of Rhaegar)|children]]!|Oberyn to Ser [[Gregor Clegane]]|The Mountain and the Viper}}

'''Oberyn Martell''' is a major character in the [[Season 4|fourth season]]<ref>http://winteriscoming.net/2013/05/grrm-confirms-red-viper-mace-magnar-being-cast/</ref>. He is portrayed by [[Pedro Pascal]] and first appears in "[[Two Swords]]".<ref>[http://insidetv.ew.com/2013/06/28/thrones-red-viper-oberyn/ Entertainment Weekly]</ref> He's a member of [[House Martell]], the [[Great house|ruling family]] of [[Dorne]].  Oberyn is well known for his fighting skills, passionate temper, and sexual appetites.

[[Prince]] Oberyn, known as the '''Red Viper of Dorne''',<ref>"[[The Mountain and the Viper]]</ref> is the younger brother of [[Doran Martell]], the [[Prince of Dorne]], and the late [[Elia Martell]], wife of [[Rhaegar Targaryen]], the late [[Prince of Dragonstone]] and heir to the [[Iron Throne]]. Traveling to King's Landing to attend Joffrey's royal wedding in his brother's place, Oberyn's real motive is to seek revenge for the murder and rape of his sister by Tywin's bannerman, [[Gregor Clegane]].  Oberyn gets an opportunity to kill Clegane when he volunteers to champion [[Tyrion Lannister]] in a [[trial by combat]]; although he manages to severely wound and poison Clegane, he is ultimately killed.
sections.In the books:
In the ''[[A Song of Ice and Fire]]'' novels, Prince Oberyn is the hot-headed younger brother of Prince [[Doran Martell]]. He has eight [[bastard]]Â daughters, called the [[Sand Snakes]], the four youngest of them by his current paramour, [[Ellaria Sand]].Â 

Oberyn has a lined face with thin eyebrows, black "viper" eyes and a sharp nose. His hair is lustrous and black with only a few silver streaks and recedes from his brow into a widow's peak. It is rumored that he has sexual relationsÂ with his squires whenÂ Ellaria is unavailable. It is not unusual for lords and ladies in Dorne to be openly bisexual, due to the relaxed attitude towards sexuality among the Dornish.

Oberyn is called "the Red Viper" by friend and foe alike due to his penchant for coating his weapons in lethal poisons, so that even a glancing wound will prove fatal.

Oberyn was the youngest of the three Martell siblings:  Elia was born nine years after Doran, and Oberyn one year after Elia.

During a tourney, Oberyn jousted against [[Willas Tyrell]], eldest son of [[Mace Tyrell]] and heir to [[Highgarden]]. Oberyn knocked Willas from his horse, but Willas's foot got caught in the stirrup and the horse fell on him, crushing his leg and leaving him crippled. Though Willas does not personally bear any ill-will towards Oberyn for the incident and they continue a friendly correspondence, it becomes a new source of friction in the ancient feud between Dorne and the Reach.

Although Oberyn is known to have studied to become a [[Maesters|maester]] in his youth - successfully forging several links of his chain - he is noted to have studied the poisoner's art while travelling the [[Free Cities]], not at [[the Citadel]], as the show specifies.

When treating Gregor Clegane, Qyburn theorizes that Oberyn had adulterated the manticore venom on his spear with sorcery; thickening it in order to slow it's progress through the veins towards the heart, dragging out Gregor's agony.

sections.Personality:
Oberyn Martell is a forceful, lusty man with a quick wit and barbed tongue.  He is renowned for his duels, his temper, his keen intellect, and his carnality.  Oberyn traveled the world in his youth, and even fought in a mercenary company in Essos - his skill with a spear is enough to face off evenly against the feared Gregor Clegane in a duel. He had a very close relationship with his sister Elia and they were inseparable as children.  Oberyn is also a very intelligent man:  he studied at [[The Citadel|the Citadel]] for several years before deciding he was simply bored with a future as a [[Maesters|maester]] and left.  During that time he studied [[Poison|poisons]] extensively, which he frequently coats his weapons with. 

Above all Oberyn is a deeply passionate man, with a hot temper that often leads him into duels and grudges, but in equal measure this also makes him deeply loyal to those he cares about, such as his siblings, his paramour [[Ellaria Sand|Ellaria]], and his daughters.  

Oberyn's overall attitude is that life is short, and one must enjoy all of life's pleasures while one can - thus his sexual adventures have become infamous, and popular rumor has it that he must have had sex with half of the people he has ever met on both sides of the Narrow Sea.  Oberyn is a deeply honorable man, but his philosophy in life is that he doesn't care about the negative opinions of others - he would rather live life on his own terms, openly challenging his enemies and risk destruction rather than live by someone else's rules.
